message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.PL 

This paper is primarily focused on the networking aspects of Software Defined Networks (SDN), specifically the challenge of consistently updating switch rules while preserving per-packet consistency. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). 

The paper also discusses the need to apply policies consistently and prevent packet drops and loops, which are relevant to the sub-categories of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.SY (Systems and Control). 

The use of programmable switches and data plane time stamps is also mentioned, which falls under the sub-category of cs.PL (Programming Languages). 

Finally, the paper proposes a general update algorithm that is concurrent and provides all-or-nothing semantics, which is related to the sub-category of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing).
